In summary, LEM-3 plays a crucial role in maintaining the quiescence and stemness of LSCs in AML, and its depletion leads to the activation of mTORC1 signaling, which in turn drives LSCs into cycling and exhaustion. The regulation of mTORC1 activity by Rictor and the negative feedback mechanism mediated by FoxO3a are critical in maintaining the balance of LSCs and preventing their exhaustion.
